dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey B, so I was looking at this new Global Liveability Index, you know, the one that ranks the best cities to call home?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey B, so I was looking at this new Global Liveability Index, you know, the one that ranks the best cities to call home?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah! I saw something about that. Always interesting to see where people are actually *living* well. What's the big takeaway this year?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah! I saw something about that. Always interesting to see where people are actually living well. What's the big takeaway this year?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the headline grabber for me is, uh, not a single U.S. city made the cut for the top ten. Like, *zero*.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the headline grabber for me is, uh, not a single U S city made the cut for the top ten. Like, zero.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the Global Liveability Index, a measurement of the world's best cities to call home, not a single U.S. city was good enough to make the cut.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Wait, really? Not even one? That's... that's kind of surprising. I mean, we always hear about New York or L.A.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, really? Not even one? That's... that's kind of surprising. I mean, we always hear about New York or L A.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Nope. And get this, Canada, our neighbor to the north? They had three cities in the top ten. Calgary, Vancouver, Toronto.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nope. And get this, Canada, our neighbor to the north? They had three cities in the top ten. Calgary, Vancouver, Toronto.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Canada had three cities, by comparison, including Calgary (3), Vancouver (6) and Toronto (7).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, good for them! So who actually nabbed the number one spot then, if it wasn't, like, a North American city?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, good for them! So who actually nabbed the number one spot then, if it wasn't, like, a North American city?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Drumroll, please... It was Vienna, Austria. Again! They're consistently up there, it seems.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Drumroll, please... It was Vienna, Austria. Again! They're consistently up there, it seems.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The best city to live was Vienna, Austria.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Vienna, huh? I can see that. But what are they even looking at, you know, to decide these things?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Vienna, huh? I can see that. But what are they even looking at, you know, to decide these things?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: They compare cities on stuff like security, affordability, education, healthcare, um, urban lifestyle, infrastructure... all those big things.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They compare cities on stuff like security, affordability, education, healthcare, um, urban lifestyle, infrastructure... all those big things.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Global Liveability Index compares world cities with each other in terms of security, affordability, education, healthcare, its urban lifestyle and infrastructure.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, so it's not just about, like, having a cool coffee shop on every corner. It's the whole package.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, so it's not just about, like, having a cool coffee shop on every corner. It's the whole package.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And the study pointed out that the best cities tend to be midsize, in wealthier countries, and often have a lower population density.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And the study pointed out that the best cities tend to be midsize, in wealthier countries, and often have a lower population density.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Those that score best tend to be midsize cities in wealthier countries. Several cities in the top 10 also have relatively low population density.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Ah, that makes sense. So, like, maybe that's why New York or London don't make the top ten? Too dense, too much going on?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ah, that makes sense. So, like, maybe that's why New York or London don't make the top ten? Too dense, too much going on?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Precisely! They call them "victims of their own success." The big city buzz comes with, uh, burdened infrastructure, higher crime, congestion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Precisely! They call them victims of their own success. The big city buzz comes with, uh, burdened infrastructure, higher crime, congestion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Global business centers tend to be victims of their own success, analysts from The Economist Intelligence Unit wrote in the index report released Monday. The big city buzz comes with heavily burdened infrastructure, poverty and higher crime rates.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I guess that makes sense. You get all the bells and whistles, but then you also get the headaches. So, what about the US cities then? Honolulu was the best, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I guess that makes sense. You get all the bells and whistles, but then you also get the headaches. So, what about the U S cities then? Honolulu was the best, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The best American city on a global scale was Honolulu.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, Honolulu was the best American city on a global scale, but it was much further down the list. Not in the top ten.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Honolulu was the best American city on a global scale, but it was much further down the list. Not in the top ten.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The best American city on a global scale was Honolulu. That doesn't necessarily mean that U.S. cities are getting worse. It just means that other cities on the scale are getting better compared to one another.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Interesting. But it doesn't mean US cities are getting worse, does it? Just that others are... improving faster?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Interesting. But it doesn't mean U S cities are getting worse, does it? Just that others are... improving faster?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's what the report suggests! It's all relative. Like, Western Europe and the US still have tons of highly liveable cities, just not at the very, very top of *this* specific index.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's what the report suggests! It's all relative. Like, Western Europe and the U S still have tons of highly liveable cities, just not at the very, very top of this specific index.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Both the U.S and Europe are home to the world's most liveable cities. Western Europe has 9 of the top 20 cities, and 26 of the top 66 cities with average scores on things like infrastructure and safety of over 80%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, that's good to know. So the Western world isn't, like, completely falling apart just yet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, that's good to know. So the Western world isn't, like, completely falling apart just yet.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] Definitely not. And actually, in emerging markets, Buenos Aires was ranked the best. So some surprising contenders out there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely not. And actually, in emerging markets, Buenos Aires was ranked the best. So some surprising contenders out there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Within the emerging market cityscape, Buenos Aires is the best of show (62), followed by Moscow (68) and St. Petersburg (70).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Buenos Aires! That's cool. Well, it's a lot to think about, A. Makes me want to pack my bags for Vienna.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Buenos Aires! That's cool. Well, it's a lot to think about, A. Makes me want to pack my bags for Vienna.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Me too, B. Me too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Me too, B. Me too.
